gate.taggerframework

Class GenericTagger

  • java.lang.Object
    • gate.util.AbstractFeatureBearer
      • gate.creole.AbstractResource
        • gate.creole.AbstractProcessingResource
          • gate.creole.AbstractLanguageAnalyser
            • gate.taggerframework.GenericTagger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gate.creole.ANNIEConstants, gate.Executable, gate.LanguageAnalyser, gate.ProcessingResource, gate.Resource, gate.util.FeatureBearer, gate.util.NameBearer, Serializable

    @CreoleResource(comment="The Generic Tagger is Generic!",
                helpURL="http://gate.ac.uk/userguide/sec:parsers:taggerframework")
public class GenericTagger
extends gate.creole.AbstractLanguageAnalyser
implements gate.ProcessingResource
    This processing resource is designed to allow the easy use of a number of external (non Java) taggers within GATE. A number of assumptions have been made about the external taggers in order to provide this framework, but any tagger that expects one annotation type per line and outputs one annotation type per line (input and output do not have to be the same) should be compatible with this PR.
    Author:
    Mark A. Greenwood, Rene Witte
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws gate.creole.ExecutionException
        This method does all the work by calling the protected methods in the right order so that an input file is written, a command line is built, the tagger is run and then finally the output of the tagger is added as annotations onto the GATE document being processed.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface gate.Executable
        Overrides:
        execute in class gate.creole.AbstractProcessingResource
        Throws:
        gate.creole.ExecutionException - if an error occurs during any stage of running the tagger

      • buildCommandLine

        protected String[] buildCommandLine(File textfile)
                             throws gate.creole.ExecutionException
        This method constructs an array of Strings which will be used as the command line for executing the external tagger through a call to Runtime.exec(). This uses the tagger binary and flags to build the command line. If the system property shell.path has been set then the command line will be built so that the tagger is run by the provided shell. This is useful on Windows where you will usually need to run the tagger under Cygwin or the Command Prompt.
        Parameters:
        textfile - the file containing the input to the tagger
        Returns:
        a String array containing the correctly assembled command line
        Throws:
        gate.creole.ExecutionException - if an error occurs whilst building the command line

      • getCurrentText

        protected File getCurrentText()
                       throws gate.creole.ExecutionException
        This method copies specific annotations from the current GATE document into a file that can be read by the tagger.
        Returns:
        a File object which contains the input to the tagger
        Throws:
        gate.creole.ExecutionException - if an error occurs while building the tagger input file

      • taggerInputFor

        protected String taggerInputFor(gate.Annotation ann)
                         throws gate.creole.ExecutionException
        Returns the text that will be sent to the tagger for a given annotation. By default this is simply the value of the "string" feature from the annotation. If this assumption does not match the tagger you wish to use then you will need to create a subclass and override this method.
        Parameters:
        ann - the annotation
        Returns:
        the string to be passed to the tagger for this annotation
        Throws:
        gate.creole.ExecutionException

      • runTagger

        protected InputStream runTagger(String[] cmdline)
                         throws gate.creole.ExecutionException
        This method is responsible for executing the external tagger. If a problem is going to occur this is likely to be the place!
        Parameters:
        cmdline - the command line we want to execute
        Returns:
        an InputStream from which the output of the tagger can be read
        Throws:
        gate.creole.ExecutionException - if an error occurs executing the tagger

      • readOutput

        protected void readOutput(InputStream in)
                   throws gate.creole.ExecutionException
        This method reads the output from the tagger adding the information back into the GATE document. If the tagger doesn't produce one line per output type then you will need to override this to do something different.
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream frmo which the method will read the output from the tagger
        Throws:
        gate.creole.ExecutionException - if an error occurs while handling the output from the tagger

      • setInputTemplate

        @RunTime
 @CreoleParameter(defaultValue="${string}",
                 comment="Template used to build the line of input to the tagger from the features of a single annotation.  Should include ${feature} placeholders which will be replaced by the value of the corresponding feature from the annotation.")
public void setInputTemplate(String inputTemplate)
